briefTitle: Hydroxychloroquine and Phlebotomy for Treating Porphyria Cutanea Tarda
officialTitle: A Prospective Comparison of Low Dose Hydroxychloroquine and Phlebotomy in the Treatment of Porphyria Cutanea Tarda. IRB 02-435

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol, Statistical Analysis Plan, and Informed Consent Form

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Documented porphyria cutanea tarda (PCT)
* Willing to give informed consent
* Age 18 or greater

Exclusion Criteria:

* Blistering skin lesions due to another condition

primary.description: Time to a decrease in plasma porphyrin concentration to less than 0.9 mcg/dL
primary.timeFrame: To end of study, an average of 3 years

secondary.description: 50% reduction in plasma porphyrin level during treatment
secondary.timeFrame: To end of study, an average of 3 years

secondary.description: Time to 75% reduction in plasma porphyrin level during treatment
secondary.timeFrame: To end of study, an average of 3 years

secondary.measure: Number of Days With Normal Urinary Porphyrin Levels
secondary.description: Number of days to normal urinary porphyrin levels for participants treated for Porphyria Cutanea Tarda (PCT). Days are summed together for all participants for a single value in each Arm.
secondary.timeFrame: To end of study, an average of 3 years
